website_summaries.verdict: Despite some issues, choose this model if you prefer a smaller mug and like the peace of mind of the company's guarantee.
pros: Earns praise for doing a good job mixing beverages
Holds 8 ounces, which is ideal for consumers who prefer a compact, standard cup size
Customer satisfaction guaranteed by the manufacturer
cons: A few owners gripe about it failing after a few uses, but some suggest keeping the bottom dry might help prevent issues

customer_reviews.title: motor died shortly after using
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my bf and It worked great for a few weeks and then wouldnt turn on. Thought maybe the batteries had died so we replaced them. There’s a slight whirring sound when the button is pressed but it no longer spins. Very disappointing that it stopped working so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Always wanted one and now i have it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cup. Batteries are in the bottom so i dont put it in the dishwasher or submerge it. Just rinse it out with hot water and wipe it with a towel. I did leave coffee in it over night and went to rinse it but the little thing wouldn't spin,so i spun it by hand and there was a little resistance but broke loose and still works perfectly. So something to try if you think its broken. Also the button is a little fidgety so you gotta press it in different places a few times
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Almost...but not quite there yet.
customer_reviews.text: A bit better than last two I bought. It didn’t leak all over the place. Lid stayed on. Worked great....when it worked. Had it for a couple weeks. One morning...just didn’t turn on. It was dry. Battery compartment never saw water....so how’d it just die. Even tried new batteries....but nothing. So far, I haven’t had any success with these things....cheap ones or more expensive ones. While the idea is nice....noone seems to grasp the mechanics yet to even make it worth it. I’ve bought a total of 5 so far. Smh.
customer_reviews.author: S. Trusty

customer_reviews.title: I loved this product
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product! I was a little apprehensive to purchase this, but in the end of the day, it worth it a lot! So cool and easy to use. The only thing is that I must say is that, if you drink powder shakes, try to not put too much pownder in it. It would take longer to stir. And also, you may use a spoon to help to disssolve all the powder at beginning, but after a few minutes the mug does it works! Really nice. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosana Sueli Carmonario

customer_reviews.title: Seems a bit like a gimmick
customer_reviews.text: Seems a bit like a gimmick, HOWEVER, my dad recently had a stroke and can only use one hand. He LOVES this mug. No one as to do it for him. So while it was a long shot, this has helped him so much. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Ckulzer

customer_reviews.title: Worked less than a week!
customer_reviews.text: I was eager to get the self stirring cup because I enjoy hot chocolate . I knew it would stay warmer longer if I could leave the top on instead of removing it to stir the chocolate every few minutes. The cup worked just the way I expected the first couple of days. THEN the on/off button seemed to be shifting under the rubber cover, and the rubber button cover came off completely. The stirrer in the botton ceased to turn, and I am left with a lightweight cup that does nothing special and cannot go in dishwasher; probably destined for trash!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using it for my bullet proof coffee. Ordering another ...
customer_reviews.text: Using it for my bullet proof coffee. Ordering another one for my husband. Much neater and easier than using an emersion blender.
customer_reviews.author: robin

customer_reviews.title: Cup is plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I think the idea was pretty cool but I was disappointed in the quality of the cup. The rubber seal around the lid came off when I opened it for the first time. Cup doesn’t seem sturdy. The cup is plastic. I want to use it at work but I am not sure how long it will keep my coffee warm.
customer_reviews.author: Dmalbrew

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mug! It doesn't hold too much coffee as I throw in powder creamer and a little International Delight liquid creamer in there, but the fact that it mixes these altogether from the bottom causes less mess vs a regular mug and having to stir all these ingredients togther from the top, which causes the mixture to spill over the edges creating big messes. The only little issue I have found is the bottom of the mug that holds the batteries isn't fully secure and easily comes off. Either way, I continue to recommend this mug to anyone, coffee drinker or not!
customer_reviews.author: Jaynie Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: More of a novelty item. Not good for beverages.
customer_reviews.text: It had broken pieces when I got it but it worked so I thought I'd give it a try. It was pretty cool. But, I left some drink in it for a couple hours and it leaked down into the battery compartment and it does not work at all now. It's a cool mug but not very well made. I wouldn't get another one. I'll stick with a spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: My first impression of this mug was, "it's ok"...The lid didn't fit tightly so I would accidentally knock it off and with the shape and size of the mug, it wouldn't fit in the cup holder of my car. I purchased it to stir my bulletproof coffee each morning and surprisingly the little motor and fan worked well. Unfortunately after about 2 weeks it stopped working (yes, I tried replacing the batteries). I am now returning it and will search for a better quality self-stirring mug.
customer_reviews.author: KLG

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Mug worked perfectly out of the box.. for one use. Unfortunately, it stopped working almost immediately. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: robin clark

customer_reviews.title: Fun mug!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift. It works great and really does it’s job. The bottom does not keep out any water so if you put it in your sink or clean it well, the water gets into the bottom where the batteries are kept and the batteries corrode quickly. I was disappointed with the battery compartment design. It’s a fun novelty gift though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best one.
customer_reviews.text: All the others in this price range quit working within a month. This one will work for probably 6 months or more. It's about what you can expect, though mine is still going strong. Don't leave liquid in it overnight, just empty it after you're done and rinse.
customer_reviews.author: hopper433

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: it was great at first, but after about two months, it just stopped working for no reason! I thought it was the batteries, nope. I never washed it in the dishwasher or dropped it or anything. I was looking forward to this product so I would stop using so many spoons so often, but now I’m back to my old ways
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Love them, but longevity is beyond suspect.

customer_reviews.title: Life-Changing... When it Works
customer_reviews.text: I've had three different self-stirring mugs in the past year or so and they have all broken within a few weeks of use. The idea is a fantastic one, the stirring mechanism works great, and the mugs make for a great conversation piece. They're also great at keeping drinks warm. However, if even the slightest amount of water touches the bottom of the mug, it's over. That makes washing the mugs complicated. I'm disappointed because I really want to love self-stirring mugs, but the finicky mechanics is making it hard.

product_meta.title: Self Stirring Coffee Mug Cup - Funny Electric Stainless Steel Automatic Self Mixing & Spinning Home Office Travel Mixer Cup Best Cute Christmas Birthday Gift Idea for Men Women Kids 8 oz by Chuzy Chef
product_meta.description:
Size:1 pack

The Coffee Mug for Lazy People Powered by two AAA batteries, the iCooker coffee mug is a great accessory to have in your kitchen.

But more so, this is considered the best beverage-mug for 'lazy people'. If you consider the hassle of washing spoons, stirring beverages and then washing again to be quite a bother, this coffee mug simply does the work for you.

All you need to do is pour in your coffee(or any other beverage for that matter) and then press a button. Does everything within seconds. Nice Feel, Great Look This premium self-stirring coffee mug looks great all the way, and feels even better on any kitchen ecosystem. The power-on button is conveniently located at the top of the hold-handle, so you can easily turn the propeller on. When empty, the inside has an appealing, clean-silverish look, which blends with the dark exterior for an overly appealing design.

Easy Operation Whilethis coffee mug looks great on any kitchen counter board and/or coffee table, its essence is to make work easier. More than the typical self-stirring coffee mug, this kitchen accessory works in an easy, convenient way. Simply press the self-stirring button on the mug and the propeller at the bottom will spin into action, mixing the solute and solvent particles into a lovely froth.

No sweat, no hassle, just a product that makes stirring beverages a whole lot easier! Airtight Lid With Small Drinking Hole If you love to sip at your coffee while you spin out of your home in the morning rush, this is the perfect accessory to have in our kitchen. The iCooker self-stirring coffee mug not just brings the benefits of instant stirring action to your coffee making moments, but also comes with an airtight lid equipped with a small drinking hole.
